snippet: As the workers dangled 69 stories above the street, emergency crews cut a hole in a window of the tower and pulled them, unhurt, into the building.
abstract: New York City firefighters safely rescue window washers Juan Lizama and Juan Lopez from a dangling scaffold outside the 69th floor of 1 World Trade Center; experts blame equipment failure for the accident.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Al Baker, David W. Dunlap, Benjamin Mueller and Tatiana Schlossberg, and research by Elisa Cho and Alain Delaquérière.

lead_paragraph: As the workers dangled 69 stories above the street, emergency crews cut a hole in a window of the tower and pulled them, unhurt, into the building.

headline.main: Peril, and Daring, at 1 World Trade Center as Window Washers Are Trapped
headline.print_headline: Peril, and Daring, 69 Stories Above Ground Zero
